name: Ross Gibson

roles_in_work.title: Potential acquisitions; potential projects; projects underway.
Ross Gibson and Clare Stewart Radio National interview

biography:
Gibson makes books, essays and films.  He also designs multimedia environments for museums and public spaces.
His books include The Diminishing Paradise (1984), South of the West (1992), The Bond Store Tales (1996), Exchanges (1996, editor) and Seven Versions of an Australian Badland (2002).
His films include Camera Natura (1985), Dead to the World (1931) and Wild (1993).
From 1993 until 1996 he was a Senior Consultant Producer for the inaugral phase of the Museum of Sydney.  For two years following, he was the Australia Council Fellow in New Media.  Then between 1999 and 2002 he was Creative Director during the establishment of the Australian Centre for the Moving Image.
He is now Research Professor of New Media & Digital Culture at the University of Technology, Sydney.

Taken from PROOF exhibition (2004).
